abstract: Sec of State John Kerry downplays expectations for upcoming Syrian peace talks in Vienna; world leaders are together in opposition to Islamic State, but disagree on status of rebel groups and whether Bashar al-Assad should retain power, an idea United States opposes.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry indicated Thursday that there was a vast gulf among world leaders on the future of the Syrian president, but a shared commitment to defeating the Islamic State.

headline.main: John Kerry Tempers Expectations for Syria Talks
headline.print_headline: Kerry Tempers Expectations for Syria Talks

snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry indicated Thursday that there was a vast gulf among world leaders on the future of the Syrian president, but a shared commitment to defeating the Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
